work.name: Robot learning Lab, Aalto University
work.summary: Developing neural architecture search methods for large search spaces to enable the discovery of novel arcitectures.

work.name: Capalo AI
highlights: Developed a simulation framework for Nordic electricity pricing markets.
Refined existing multi-market optimization algorithm for day-ahead electricity trading with batteries.

work.name: Speech and coginition research group, Tampere University
work.summary: Developed a customazible GUI for time-series annotation. Compared to the existing solutions, the created tool was able to display multiple different data-sources, such as EEG, speech and video

work.name: Device concept lab, Huawei Technologies Finland
highlights: Worked with a parameter estimation problem with a small-scale dataset with a large proportion of missing values.
The problem was cast to a data imputation task, allowing one to utilize existing research to solve the problem.

work.name: Device concept lab, Huawei Technologies Finland
highlights: Developed a tool for solving discrete optimization problems, which supported multiple higher-level programming languages.
The developed methodology improved the previously found solutions and solved previously unattainable problmes.

work.name: Faculty of management and business, Tampere University
work.summary: Main responsibilities included web-scraping and exploring options for implementing a natural language parser for Finnish text.

work.name: Teaching assistant, Faculty of engineering and natural sciences, Tampere University
work.summary: Organized and taught weekly exercise sessions in an introductory course on automation and control system theory

awards.title: Best BSc thesis award
awards.awarder: Industrial Research Fund at Tampere University of Technology

projects.name: (MSc thesis) Generalizing Pareto Optimal Policies in multi-objective reinforcement learning
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
